{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3570492,"name":"","username":"Matheus","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/ecd19e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T20:05:58.374Z","cooked":"

Hello everyone, our autonomous is done by pathfinding, we use a limelight 4 to update its position during the autonomous period, however sometimes the robot simply when it goes to pick up at the coral station does not execute the next command because in the simulation it goes a little outside the arena, any idea of ​​what to do to solve this problem of every time it goes out even a little, it simply stops

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T20:05:58.374Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":133,"readers_count":132,"score":66.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497149,"topic_slug":"autonomous-problem","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64053,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/autonomous-problem/497149/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3570514,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T20:34:44.353Z","cooked":"

If you can fix your odometry, do that. You might have an angle that’s off slightly, or need to adjust your confidence/standard deviation values.

However, a good practice is to set a time out on the command, correlating with a bit more time than it should normally take. We like to give them an extra 20-50% time. This ensures that for minor positional errors, it’ll still move on, even if it’s a bit behind schedule. You generally don’t want to rely on time outs, but they can save your bacon when something weird happens.

Another option is use your intake routine in parallel with the drive back one. This way, when the robot arrives at the coral station, it can intake a game piece regardless of if it’s stuck driving, and the game piece allows everything to early-exit. Something like this

sequence(
/*score first coral*/,
parallelRaceGroup(drive back, intakeCoral).until(has game piece)
intakeCoral.until(has game piece)

We did this optimization due to the exact same struggle, and it significantly increased our auto’s robustness and speed.

The problem is also that after he picks up the game piece, if he is out of the field in the odometry, the pathfinding path will not even run.

Im so sorry

because in the simulation

Is this just in simulation, or is this also happening on a physical robot?
Simulations are excellent in theory, and extremely helpful, but from time to time you’ll encounter problems that only exist there. A physical robot won’t get stuck inside a wall, and PP’s pathfinding will always hop outside of the wall when calculating navigation paths on the nav mesh.

Well, I’m at a loss on that one. We don’t run any sort of simulation tooling on a robot.

In the interest of teeing this up for someone else, what are you using for drive train control? Is this the CTRE builder, a template, Yagsl, or something else? If you have a link to your code, that’ll help diagnose potential errors.
